overview: With more than 25+ years of experience in the telecommunications industry, James DaBramo is responsible for Airbandâ€™s sales, channel and account management organizations. As executive vice president of sales, DaBramo leads the sales and channel teams focused Airbandâ€™s key segments including small- and medium-sized businesses, enterprises, wholesale carriers and channel partners. DaBramo joins Airband from FDN, a Florida-based CLEC where as founder and EVP of sales, he grew the company from zero revenue to over $150 million within six years. FDN merged with NuVox Communications in 2007 where DaBramo led the Wholesale, Government and MDU Sales Operations. Prior to that, he was a founder and VP of Sales & Marketing for Metro Access Networks (MAN) based in Dallas, Texas. MAN was purchased by Brooks Fiber Systems, a fiber optics services company based in St. Louis MO. DaBramo became the leading VP of sales for Brooks representing the Southwest region. Brooks was acquired by MCI WorldCom in 1998.

degrees.institution: Hartwick College in Oneonta, New York
